title: Westminster Larger Catechism
about: The Westminster Larger Catechism is a comprehensive theological guide that systematically articulates Reformed doctrine, emphasizing the sovereignty of God, the person and work of Christ, the application of redemption, and the believer’s duty to glorify and enjoy God, making it a foundational teaching tool for deepening Christian faith and practice.

questions.question: Q. What is the chief and highest end of man?
questions.answer: A. Man’s chief and highest end is to glorify God, and fully to enjoy him for ever.

questions.text: Q. How doth it appear that there is a God?
questions.answer: A. The very light of nature in man, and the works of God, declare plainly that there is a God; but his Word and Spirit only, do sufficiently and effectually reveal him unto men for their salvation.

questions.text: Q. What is the Word of God?
questions.answer: A. The Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments are the Word of God, the only rule of faith and obedience.

questions.text: Q. How doth it appear that the Scriptures are the Word of God?
questions.answer: A. The Scriptures manifest themselves to be the Word of God, by their majesty and purity; by the consent of all the parts, and the scope of the whole, which is to give all glory to God; by their light and power to convince and convert sinners, to comfort and build up believers unto salvation: but the Spirit of God bearing witness by and with the Scriptures in the heart of man, is alone able fully to persuade it that they are the very Word of God.

questions.text: Q. What do the Scriptures principally teach?
questions.answer: A. The Scriptures principally teach, what man is to believe concerning God, and what duty God requires of man.

questions.text: Q. What do the Scriptures make known of God?
questions.answer: A. The Scriptures make known what God is, the persons in the Godhead, his decrees, and the execution of his decrees.
